questions.question: In the Verilog implementation of a SISO register, what is the purpose of the non-blocking assignment (<=)?

answers.b: To ensure sequential behavior in the always block

explanations.a: Non-blocking assignments are not used for arithmetic operations
explanations.b: Correct! Non-blocking assignments ensure proper sequential behavior by evaluating all right-hand sides before making assignments
explanations.c: Combinational logic typically uses blocking assignments (=)
explanations.d: Clock signals are generated separately, not through assignments

questions.question: What is the delay between input and output in a 4-bit SISO register?

explanations.a: This would be true for a 1-bit register
explanations.b: This would be true for a 2-bit register
explanations.c: This would be true for a 3-bit register
explanations.d: Correct! A 4-bit register has a 4-clock cycle delay as data moves through each flip-flop

questions.question: What happens to the data in a SISO register when the reset signal is active?

answers.d: The register stops responding to the clock

explanations.b: Reset typically clears the register to 0, not 1
explanations.c: Correct! The reset signal clears all bits to 0 in the register
explanations.d: The register still responds to the clock, but maintains 0 during reset

questions.question: Which Verilog construct is used to implement the sequential behavior of a register?

explanations.a: initial blocks are used for testbenches, not sequential logic
explanations.b: Correct! The always @(posedge clk) block implements sequential behavior triggered by clock edges
explanations.c: assign statements are used for combinational logic
explanations.d: functions are used for reusable code, not sequential behavior

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a SISO register over a parallel register?

explanations.a: SISO registers are actually slower as they transfer one bit at a time
explanations.b: Correct! SISO registers require fewer pins as data is transferred serially
explanations.c: The storage capacity is the same for both types of registers
explanations.d: Power consumption is not the primary advantage of SISO registers
